element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm computes Ripley's K for a set of points.
Values produced by this algorithm can be used to identify the type of spatial pattern created by the point process that those input points represent.

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: * Ripley, B.D. (1976). The second-order analysis of spatial point processes, Journal of Applied Probability 13, 255–266. * http://www.geog.ucsb.edu/~dongmei/ppa/ppa.html

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The new table contain the following fields: * Distance * K-function value * K- function value of a completeley random (Poisson) point process * L value
